title: SB 1325
content: The people of the State of California enact the following. The department reviews and approves plans submitted under Section 25246 of the Health and Safety Code if they comply with regulations and state/federal laws. Approval is contingent on compliance with Water Code Section 13227. The department will not approve a plan until it meets certain conditions: approval under Water Code Section 13227, 60 days have passed since submission for interim status facilities, or immediate approval is necessary for public health or safety. Any department action is subject to Section 25204.5. The department will impose hazardous waste facility postclosure plan requirements on owners or operators through enforcement orders, agreements, or permits, subject to approval under the California Environmental Quality Act. Before approving or modifying a hazardous waste facility postclosure plan, the department must allow for public involvement, including notice and comment opportunities. The department determines a "significant modification" as a class 3 permit modification for hazardous waste facilities. The decision is based on similarities to class 3 modifications in regulations and public concern. The department considers public concern and the complexity of the proposed modification to determine if it qualifies as a class 3 permit modification for hazardous waste facilities. The department has the authority to order necessary actions at a facility to protect public health and safety. If the department imposes a hazardous waste facility postclosure plan through an enforcement order or agreement, the owner must pay a fee specified in Section 25205.7. The postclosure period begins on the effective date of the postclosure permit, enforcement order, or enforceable agreement as specified in Section 25205.4. The department may enforce a postclosure plan through actions such as filing an injunction, requiring corrective action, and assessing civil penalties for violations. The department can enforce a postclosure plan by taking actions like filing for civil penalties for violations. Postclosure plan requirements must be adopted by the department by January 1, 2018. The department must adopt regulations by January 1, 2018, to impose postclosure plan requirements. If deemed necessary, the department can replace an enforcement order with a postclosure permit for a hazardous waste facility. The department has the authority to order actions to protect public health and the environment at a facility. Section 25247 of the Health and Safety Code is amended to require the department to review and approve plans that comply with regulations and state/federal laws before approval. The department must approve a plan for a facility under certain conditions, including approval under Water Code Section 13227, expiration of 60 days after submission by the owner/operator, or immediate approval for public health or safety reasons. Any department action is subject to Section 25204.5. The department must approve a hazardous waste facility postclosure plan under certain conditions, such as approval under Water Code Section 13227 or immediate approval for public health or safety reasons. Any department action taken is subject to Section 25204.5 and shall comply with the California Environmental Quality Act. Before approving or modifying a hazardous waste facility postclosure plan, the department must allow public involvement, including notice and comment opportunities. The department determines if a modification is significant based on class 3 permit criteria and public concern. The department considers public concern and the complexity of the proposed modification to determine if it qualifies as a class 3 modification. The department can order necessary actions at a facility to protect public health or safety, regardless of any limitations or delays. If the department issues a hazardous waste facility postclosure plan through an enforcement order or enforceable agreement instead of a postclosure permit, the owner or operator must enter into a cost reimbursement agreement and pay the required fee at the start of the postclosure period. The postclosure period begins on the effective date of the postclosure permit, enforcement order, or enforceable agreement. The department may enforce a postclosure plan through various actions, including filing an injunction, requiring corrective action, and assessing civil penalties for violations. The department can enforce a postclosure plan by taking actions such as filing for civil penalties for violations. Postclosure plan requirements must be adopted by the department by January 1, 2018. The department must adopt regulations by January 1, 2018, to impose postclosure plan requirements. If deemed necessary, the department can replace an enforcement order with a postclosure permit for a hazardous waste facility. The department has the authority to order necessary actions at a facility to protect public health, safety, or the environment. Section 1.5 of the bill includes amendments to Section 25247 of the Health and Safety Code, contingent on the enactment of Assembly Bill 1611 or Senate Bill 839 by January 1, 2017. If this bill is enacted last, the amended Section 25247 will only be in effect until the operative date of this bill. Section 25247 of the Health and Safety Code will only remain operative until the effective date of this bill, at which point Section 1.5 of the bill will come into effect.
